publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2093 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Restoration of war crimes unit—That the Parliament welcomes the long-awaited decision by the Minister for Justice to authorise the issuing of a warrant for the arrest of Anton Gecas in relation to the extradition request made by the Lithuanian Government on 28 March 2001; believes that this will be a positive step towards improved relations between Scotland and other European countries, and calls for the reinstatement of a war crimes unit for Scotland.
S1M-2093 Restoration of war crimes unit (lodged on 30 July 2001) Colin Campbell*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-2093 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Restoration of war crimes unit—That the Parliament welcomes the long-awaited decision by the Minister for Justice to authorise the issuing of a warrant for the arrest of Anton Gecas in relation to the extradition request made by the Lithuanian Government on 28 March 2001; believes that this will be a positive step towards improved relations between Scotland and other European countries, and calls for the reinstatement of a war crimes unit for Scotland. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame
S1M-2093 Restoration of war crimes unit (lodged on 30 July 2001) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-2093 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Restoration of war crimes unit-That the Parliament welcomes the long-awaited decision by the Minister for Justice to authorise the issuing of a warrant for the arrest of Anton Gecas in relation to the extradition request made by the Lithuanian Government on 28 March 2001; believes that this will be a positive step towards improved relations between Scotland and other European countries, and calls for the reinstatement of a war crimes unit for Scotland. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-2093 Restoration of war crimes unit (lodged on 30 July 2001) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-2093 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Restoration of war crimes unit—That the Parliament welcomes the long-awaited decision by the Minister for Justice to authorise the issuing of a warrant for the arrest of Anton Gecas in relation to the extradition request made by the Lithuanian Government on 28 March 2001; believes that this will be a positive step towards improved relations between Scotland and other European countries, and calls for the reinstatement of a war crimes unit for Scotland. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson

S1M-2093 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Restoration of war crimes unit-That the Parliament welcomes the long-awaited decision by the Minister for Justice to authorise the issuing of a warrant for the arrest of Anton Gecas in relation to the extradition request made by the Lithuanian Government on 28 March 2001; believes that this will be a positive step towards improved relations between Scotland and other European countries, and calls for the reinstatement of a war crimes unit for Scotland. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson

S1M-2093 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Restoration of war crimes unit-That the Parliament welcomes the long-awaited decision by the Minister for Justice to authorise the issuing of a warrant for the arrest of Anton Gecas in relation to the extradition request made by the Lithuanian Government on 28 March 2001; believes that this will be a positive step towards improved relations between Scotland and other European countries, and calls for the reinstatement of a war crimes unit for Scotland. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Andrew Wilson
